answers.answer: I'm in exactly the same boat. I'm seeing a vbac specialist in April. If I get anything else useful from the vbac consultation I'll let you know. That's if April isnt too late for you :-)

I'm in the same boat.. I had a twin c section in 2010, and I'm gone try for a vaginal deliver this time, my doctor says its possible!! But long as I don't develop preeclampsia during the last months..
Please let me know what you find out I am due in June so april isn't too late. Thank you ladies for the responses.

hey hun well i had my c section March 2007 and December 2012 i had the honor to try a vaginal birth but i didnt want to take the chance of rupturing my uterus. So i got a c section and couldnt be more happier..good luck:)
My friend had an emergency c sec with her second.. She had her third 3 years later and had a virginal delivery with no problems.. Dont let docs put u off :) x

I had an emergency c section in 2005,and my dr says depending on how my uterus was cut.she will want me to try vbac. But a epidural will be required incase of an emergency. I founf a great site vbac facts. It has a lot of info. Good luck.

I personally LOVED my 2nd c-section experience, it was so relaxing and no labor before which made it so much less nerve wracking, the 2nd time was definitely more enjoyable, and I wouldn't change my birth experience for anything, recovery was wayyy easier too!

I also had the choice of a VBAC but opted out, I didn't want to go through hours of labor for nothing and end up with a c-section anyway, plus I had a 3 year old at home, so I wanted an easy uneventful birth, and I had to stay in the hospital longer because of laboring first with my first delivery, so this time I was in and out in 2 days instead of 4

Thank you so much for your reply. I am thinking about opting and doing the csection I still have about 3 1/2 months to decide but I guess what I really like about it is I know what to expect with a csection and also I will have a set date the baby will be here.

I had a really hard time choosing, trust me. I wanted a natural birth so bad, but the repeat c-section was such an amazing experience, my first c-section I was exhausted from being in labor for 12 hours prior, plus my hopes being crushed of a normal delivery and being terrified of recovery, the 2nd was so great. I think if you do choose a c-section you won't regret it at all, if I ever have another I'll be so anxious for my c-section experience, and I'm terrified of surgeries! Good luck either way! :)

Oh and also definitely take into consideration how many kids you'll want, with a c-section usually a doctor will recommend 4, that's it, so if you're going to want lots of kids try a VBAC, because after your 2nd c-section it's really hard to find a doctor willing to let you try vaginal.

That's all very good information, Thank you so much I think a 2nd csection is looking better.. If you don't mind me asking what was the reason you had a csection the first time. Me and my husband are only wanting 2 kids so this should be our last.

I had an emergency c section in april 2011 im now due march 18th. If I can go into labor on my own I am going to try for a vbac. If not I have a c section date on the 18th if I am not making progress. Im doing everything possible to help me try to have a successful vbac. We had a lot of complications with this pregnancy due to not healing completely from my last c section. I can change my mind at any time. I will also be watched much closer while laboring because I had a c section

I had an emergency csection after 3 days of labor Oct 2010. Dec 2011 I had a scheduled repeat csection. I wanted to try for a vbac very badly but as those two were only 14 months apart they wouldn't let me. They want the deliveries at least 18 months apart. As much as not having a vaginal delivery is a disappointment to me there is something to be said for a scheduled delivery. My mom was able to take vacation time to watch my son so my husband and I could be there for the. New arrival. Feb 2013 I had my 3rd csection which was the easiest delivery yet. Even better I have three perfect healthy babies. I wouldn't tell you what is right for you but repeat csections are not like emergent ones and the end results are the same healthy mom healthy baby. Good luck!

My first c-section was an emergency when I got to 8cms dilated and my son's heart rate was dropping with every contraction, so they did it because he was in distress. Very scary! And I completely agree with kajfreak, they are so much different, emergency and planned, it's night and day. Definitely getting family members to take time off to help with recovery and with your other child is a great help.

question: I had a csection with my son March 2011 and my doctor keeps telling me that just because I had a csection last time doesn't mean this one will end in a csection also and that I can try to go vaginally... Well lately I have been wondering if I should just opt out and go for another csection or try and do it vaginally. So my question for you ladies is what did any of you do if you were in this situation?
title: 2nd time csection
